meanings.definition: A vessel used in Roman Catholic and Anglican churches for exposing the consecrated Host to view.
meanings.sent1: The ostensory held the consecrated Host during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The priest carefully placed the Eucharistic Host in the ostensory.
meanings.sent3: During the ceremony, the ostensory seemed to glow with reverence.
meanings.sent4: The ostensory was like a precious jewel, showcasing the sacred Host.
meanings.sent5: The ostensory gleamed under the church's soft lights, drawing all eyes to the Host.

meanings.definition: Relating to or serving as a means of displaying the Eucharistic Host for adoration.
meanings.sent1: The ostensory ritual was a beautiful part of the church service.
meanings.sent2: The ostensory display was a focal point of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The ostensory design added a touch of elegance to the altar.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with an ostensory-like devotion to the Eucharistic Host.
meanings.sent5: The ostensory presence in the church created a sense of reverence and awe.
